fields.description:
In Setup.setUp(), there is a loop to call each application setup's setUp(), and then there is another loop that call each application's removeApplicationLinks() and addDefaultApplicationLinks(). However, each application's setUp() already invokes these two methods.

One of the invocations should probably be removed to save time used in setup.
fields.summary: removeApplicationLinks() and addDefaultApplicationLinks() are invoked twice for each app that is to be set up in func test

fields.description:
Hello, I was told: 
{quote}
Hi Pat,

The new [JIRA Studio Plugin Policy|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Plugin+Policy] took effect near the end of September.  For a period, we attempted to relax this policy and enabled some plugins to be installable on request.  However, relaxing our plugin policy resulted in a lot of issues, such that the last JIRA Studio upgrade required an additional maintenance period specifically to resolve plugin-related issues.

We are taking a very aggressive approach to remedying this situation in the next two upcoming releases. First off, we are working to pre-bundle a large set of plugins to ensure that the 95% most popular plugins are already installed and tested. Second, we will be adding a Plugin Manager so you can enable and configure plugins that meet your needs.

In the meantime, you'll need to raise an improvement request for specific plugins in the JIRA Studio project on http://studio.atlassian.com.
{quote}

So, I'm asking if someone can enable the calendar & Gantt plugins (or set it up as a gadget, I don't really mind either way), so can get access to this functionality in our Jira Studio instance?

I'm a big fan of Jira and have installed it in two previous companies.  This time (3rd time) I decided to try Jira Studio, however I'm shocked to see that I can't use these two useful plugins.  This could be a deal-breaker for us, since we have a huge project ($$$) and I just convinced the project manager to use jira because IT HAS THESE TWO PLUGINS.  If I can't get this to happen, it's going to be a real black-mark on the face of me and Jira as a useful project management tool.

Please help!
fields.summary: Need Calendar/Gantt / plugin gadget for our Jira Studio instance

fields.description: Add the [Zephyr Test Management Plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/18715] to the supported, bundled plugins.

Details on the Jira integration are available here:

https://support.zendesk.com/entries/38664-jira-integration

The plugin itself is at:

https://support.zendesk.com/attachments/token/x7pho30tb1otaj5/?name=zendesk-jira-plugin-1.4.0.3.jar
fields.summary: Zendesk Integration Support

fields.description:
In JIRA, the tooltips (yellow question marks) all link to pages under the JIRASTUDIO space on [CAC|http://confluence.atlassian.com] instead of the JIRA space.

This appears to be intentional as there are some Studio specific documentation linked to from some pages, e.g. https://test.jira.com/secure/admin/jira/ViewLookAndFeel.jspa

However, on other pages where it should be linking to JIRA-specific information, you are taken to the JIRASTUDIO space with a "Page Not Found" error. For example:
* https://test.jira.com/secure/admin/jira/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa
* https://test.jira.com/secure/admin/jira/ViewLinkTypes!default.jspa
* https://test.jira.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa (for advanced search)

You are presented with a link to the correct documentation in the JIRA space though, so I'll set the severity to 'minor'.
fields.summary: Many JIRA tooltips do not link to the correct space on CAC

fields.description:
I am just going to let you know how to reproduce this issue.

# Goto testNoEarlyTruncation in TestStudioSearch.java
# Change the "Page describing malicious bug I'd watch out for this one. It's super malicious" to have a extra three exclamation marks on the end like so: "Page describing malicious bug I'd watch out for this one. It's super malicious!!!"
# Make the assertions that follow it also contain the exclamation marks.
# Surprise yourself by watching the test now fail because the exclamation marks fail to render at all.

And that is all that there is to this issue; the confluence special characters that do not resolve into actual HTML markup are not displayed at all instead of being left alone as one would expect. This issue may be resolved soon by a confluence upgrade.
fields.summary: TestStudioSearch testNoEarlyTruncation shows special characters incorrectly.

fields.description:
In Studio, JIRA attachments are stored at:
* {{/data/jirastudio/jira/attachments}}

However, after performing an import where the XML backup is set to use the default path, it will be set to:
* {{/data/jirastudio/jira/data/attachments}} (note the {{data/}} directory is added).

It would save the need for a couple of JIRA restarts if this could be set, since we need to edit jira-application.properties to set a flag and restart in order to configure this option, then change it back.
fields.summary: Studio JIRA importer does not set correct attachments path

fields.description:
We have a Developer account type which is associated with a group named developers which is also tied to a Developer Role in JIRA.  I think it would make some sense to tie the Collaborator account type with a collaborators group and also add a default Collaborator Role (tied to the new collaborators group by default) in JIRA.

This should help clear up some confusion caused by the general users group and it being tied to both Collaborators and Developers by default.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Customer has requested installation of these 2 plugins:

fields.description:
User is missing one changset on Jira project page - Source subtab.

See the support ticket for details. 

I've been able to reproduce the problem when I logged as the affected user. When I logged in as sysadmin the changset is there. It doesn't seem to be permission issue as the user is able to see changset elsewhere.

I've enabled the debugging on jira-fisheye plugin and attached is a log file. It logs 2 communications: 
- as sysadmin
- as user cari

The plugin first asks for a list of changsets and then retrieves each changset in separate request.
The first request from jira to fisheye (to retrieve list of changsets) returns same data for both users. The following requests (to retrieve the actual data about each changeset) shows that plugin is requesting changesets 9246, 9242, 9238, 9227 for user sysadmin but only changesets 9246, 9242, 9238 for user cari.
fields.summary: jira-fisheye plugin doesn't return all the changesets

fields.description:
One thing that would be helpful is that when a story has subtasks, and those subtasks have work and code committed against them, that the Source tab on the story also display changesets from any subtasks.

This way, we can always go to the story to view the total set of changes made for the story.

Often times, since we make use of the IntelliJ plugin, developers will commit code against their subtask and reference that in the commit.  This also ensures that their subtasks have hours logged against them (that are rolled up into the story totals).  But we'd like the same roll-up visibility on the changes committed to version control as well.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Be able to view all change sets from subtasks in a story.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Find a new user whose access level is "Needs Activation" or "No Access". In this case, Studio is eligible for 0 collaborator and 5 developer accounts
# Add the user to a group manually, say "users" group. Studio will throw this error message despite there is more room for new developer accounts:
{quote}Errors
Adding the user to the groups you have selected will grant the 'JIRA Users' permission to the user in JIRA. This will exceed the number of users allowed to use JIRA under your license. Please reduce the number of users with the 'JIRA Users', 'JIRA Administrators' or 'JIRA System Administrators' global permissions or consider upgrading your license.
{quote}

Workaround:

# In the user browser, find the affected user
# Click 'Edit' to edit user profile
# Choose the appropriate 'Access Level' for the user. In this case, choose 'Developer'
# Click 'Update'
# You should now be able to assign the user to a group manually
fields.summary: Unable to manually assign "Needs Activation/No Access" users to a group if Collaborator is 0
